plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia tree known for its large, fragrant, tulip-shaped flowers that emerge in early spring before the leaves develop.
plants.location: Temperate regions of North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Saucer Magnolia blooms before its leaves appear, creating a spectacular floral display that can last up to two weeks.

plants.name: Lantana camara
plants.description: A hardy flowering shrub often used in warm climates as ground cover or ornamental hedges, known for clusters of small, brightly colored flowers.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to fall (including April in warmer climates)
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions worldwide, including parts of India, Africa, and the southern United States
plants.funFact: Lantana flowers can change colors as they age, attracting a variety of pollinators with different hues throughout their blooming period.

plants.name: Erythronium americanum
plants.description: A spring ephemeral wildflower growing in deciduous forests with mottled leaves resembling trout patterns and nodding yellow flowers.
plants.funFact: Yellow Trout Lily often grows in colonies formed by vegetative reproduction and is an indicator of rich, undisturbed woods.

plants.name: Wisteria sinensis
plants.description: A vigorous, deciduous climbing vine prized for its cascading clusters of fragrant flowers in spring.
plants.location: Native to China, widely cultivated in temperate regions including the United States and Europe
plants.funFact: Wisteria can live for over 50 years, and some specimens bloom for more than a month each spring.
